title: New & MPfree: Gem Club – Breakers
body:
[![](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/GCLP-950x950.jpg "Gem Club")](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/06/GCLP.jpg)

“Breakers” is the glorious new lo-fi number courtesy of Somervile duo **Gem Club**, and has already been featured on [Pitchfork](http://www.pitchfork.com/forkcast/15997-breakers/) earlier in the week. With their debut LP of the same title set to be released later in the year via [Hardly Art](http://www.hardlyart.com/), and a rapidly expanding following eagerly anticipating it’s arrival; it’s set to be a hectic year for **Gem Club**. The piano driven “Breakers” is hauntingly heartwrenching, nervously shuffling in somewhere between **Youth Lagoon** and **Perfume Genius**, and expertly utilizing the soft yet piercing vocals of Christopher Barnes. Being the first new material since last year’s EP _Acid and Everything_, this melancholic track has been met with stunning reviews, cementing the two-piece as a real talent to watch out for. Check it out below, and head over to their bandcamp to download “Breakers” for free.
